00027 #ifndef WORDINDEXDICTIONARY_H_
00028 #define WORDINDEXDICTIONARY_H_
00029 
00030 #include "boost/unordered_map.hpp"
00031 #include "types.h"
00032 #include "DocumentReader.h"
00033 #include <climits>
00034 
00035 using namespace std;
00036 using namespace boost;
00037 //!A two way dictionary of words to indices
00038 /**
00039  * Provides a two way dictionary mapping
00040  * words as strings to a unique int index
00041  * and vice versa. The hashtable implementation
00042  * of boost/unordered_map is used.
00043  *
00044  */
00045 class WordIndexDictionary {
00046 public:
00047     WordIndexDictionary();
00048     virtual ~WordIndexDictionary();
00049     int get_index(string word);
00050     string get_word(int index);
00051     int insert_word(string word);
00052     int get_num_words() const;
00053     void print();
00054     bool match_word_index();
00055     void dump(string fname);
00056     void initialize_from_dict(WordIndexDictionary* dict, bool sort = false);
00057     void initialize_from_dump(string fname, int num_words = INT_MAX, bool sort =
00058             false);
00059     void initialize_from_dumps(string prefix, int dumps);
00060     size_t size();
00061     int get_prev_index(int new_id);
00062     int get_freq(int index);
00063 
00064     vector<id2freq_t> frequencies;
00065 
00066 private:
00067     typedef unordered_map<string, int> wimap;
00068     unordered_map<string, int> word_ind_map;
00069     unordered_map<int, string> ind_word_map;
00070 
00071     wimap::iterator wi_end;
00072     int current_index;
00073     int insert_word(string word, int index_);
00074     int verify_header(DocumentReader & doc_rdr);
00075     string get_suffix(int n);
00076     void sort_on_freq();
00077     string suffices[100];
00078 };
00079 
00080 #endif /* WORDINDEXDICTIONARY_H_ */
